snp1.5:2.3: Sakkhipuṭṭho is only elsewhere used in the context of being asked to bear witness in court. I think the context is relevant here, as the Buddha is offering personal testimony on a matter that otherwise he may not speak.
snp1.5:6.2: Norman and Bodhi both read pada as “way”, but it surely means “passage” as eg. AN 4.191:1.7.
